intro: Sicyos australis, commonly known as the Australian sicyos, is a climbing vine native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant has palmate leaves that are typically divided into three to five lobes. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female blooms on the same plant. The fruit is a spiny, spherical berry that ripens to a yellowish color.
